p: The ‘carrascar’ forest degradation gives a ‘garriga’ poor in species and other formations such as Rosmarino officinalis-Linetum suffruticosi, Genisto-Cistetum clusii, Ruto angustifolii-Brachypodietum retusi or Salsolo vermiculatae-Artemisietum herbae-albae, this in part depending on the salinity and aridity of each area. In parallel, degradation of the maquis leads to the aforementioned communities plus Delphinio gracilis-Lygeetum sparti. Finally, ‘alzinar’ forest degradation gives rise to shrub or herbaceous formations such as Erico multiflorae-Thymelaeetum tinctoriae or Phlomido angustifolii-Brachypodietum retusi [ 40].
